title: WearTasker - Tasker for Wear
summary: Run any Tasker Task from your Android Wear watch!

descriptionHTML:
★ Requires Tasker to Function ★

Been looking for more to things to do from your Android Wear Watch? Look no further!
With WearTasker it is now possible to run any task you created with Tasker on your phone straight from your wrist using an Android Wear Watch!

Use the WearTasker UI on your phone to built a list of the tasks that you want to have available on your wrist. Once that's done continue on your wrist, simply click the clock, scroll down to start, and start WearTasker!
That's it! Now simply click a task and it will execute on your phone, enjoy!

★ Top 10 - Wearable Apps - http://codecondo.com ★
★ Top 31 - Best Android Wear Apps - http://www.androidauthority.com ★
★ Top 20 - Best Android Wear Apps For 2015 - http://beebom.com ★
★ Top 14 - Best Android Wear Apps And Watch - http://www.androidpolice.com ★
★ Listed in - The Best Android Wear Apps - http://lifehacker.com ★
★ Top 25 - The best Android Wear apps - http://www.phonearena.com ★

Note: The free version allows you to configure up to three tasks, if you want to launch more tasks from you wrist you will automatically be prompted to purchase the pro version. The same goes for adding folders and voice actions, these also requires a pro license!

- Tasker for Android Wear -
comments: The app works fine for what it advertises: launch a tasker task from your watch. It seems to sync your favourites and folders every time you launch it on the watch however which gives running any task a 5-6 second delay. Is there any way you can speed that up? Wear 2.0 devices tend to have plenty of space for storing data so I'm not sure why it syncs each time...

*update* After purchasing premium and setting up a complication I can no longer get the app to work, constantly getting connectivity errors. Doesn't seem very stable *end update* Tasker shortcuts as watchface complications work as expected, but I wish you could modify the name and icon. All tasks use the default icon and uses the Tasker name as the label, would be nice to change.

I'm having the same trouble as Anton.  I can place multiple complications on a face and they will have their correct names, but the buttons will all trigger the same (most recently placed) task.  A second, minor, issue: complications are only showing the default "lightning bolt" icon, despite an icon having been selected in Tasker and in WearTasker.
Worked once, now says "No connection". Might work again after reboot, but frankly, not worth it...
Great job with wear widgets, super handy! But a have a bug with widgets, all of them have different names, but trigger the same task - last one chosen.
Never got it to work, kept giving me "no connection" error on the watch, even though watch is connected (as reported in wear app), and other apps on watch have connection to phone.
recentChanges: - Launch Wear App from Tasker action (pro)
